1. image3d¶

1.1. Description¶

image3d class is the one taking care of 3d image

1.2. Function¶

class image3d.image3d.image3d(data, res=1)[source]¶

Image3d Voxel scalar data

__init__(data, res=1)[source]¶

Build the image3d object

Parameters

  • data (np.array) – array Nx3 dimention

  • res (float) – resolution of the image (default 1)

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

extract_profil(init, end)[source]¶

Extract data along a line starting at init [xi,yi,zi] and ending at end [xe,ye,ze]

Parameters

  • init (np.array) – array dimention 3

  • end (np.array) – array dimention 3

Returns

res value along the profil

Return type

np.array

Returns

xl position along the profil

Return type

np.array

inertia_tensor()[source]¶

Compute the inertia tensor of the image and retrun the eigenvalue and eigenvector. :return eigval: eigenvalue :return eigvec: eigenvector

plot(axis, pc, colorbar=<matplotlib.colors.ListedColormap object>)[source]¶

plot a slice of the 3d image

Parameters

  • axis (str) – slice perpendiculaire to the axis ‘X’,’Y’,’Z’

  • pc (str) – ratio of the position between 0 to 1

split_img(size_box, option)[source]¶

Divide the image in sub-image of box size size_box³ :param size_box: size of the cubic box :type size_box: np.float :param option: (1) paved surface without the excess surface and without overlap (2) paved and with overlap without excess surface :type option: int

texture_anisotropy(size_box)[source]¶

Compute the inertia tensor on all the image for sub image of size size_box

xcorr3d(pad=1, rad_Tukey=0, gray_level=True)[source]¶

3d autocorrelation

Parameters

  • pad (int) – Pading value 1 or 2

  • rad_Tukey (int) – radius for the Tukey function (pixel) (attenuation function : https://fr.mathworks.com/help/signal/ref/tukeywin.html)

Returns

Autocorrelation function

Return type

xcorr3d.xcorr3d

2. xcorr3d¶

2.1. Description¶

xcorr3d class is the one taking care of autocorrelation of 3d image. It herite from image3d.

2.2. Function¶

class image3d.xcorr3d.xcorr3d(data, res, Cinf)[source]¶

3D Autocorrelation function

PhiTheta_corr_length()[source]¶

Extract the correlation length in function of Theta and phi Theta is the angle in the plan xOy between [0,2*Pi] phi is the angle from z between [0,Pi/2]

__init__(data, res, Cinf)[source]¶

Construtor of xcorr3d object

Parameters

  • data (np.array) – array Nx3 dimention

  • res (float) – resolution of the image (default 1)

  • Cinf (float) –

correlation_profil(vector)[source]¶

Plot the correlation profile for a given direction vector

Parameters

vector (np.array) – unit vector length in 3 dimention

Returns

figure matplotlib

local_maxima(nb=20, win=20)[source]¶

Detect the local maximum of the autocorrelation function

Parameters

  • nb (float) – maximum nubmer of local maxima

  • win (int) – windows size for filter NxNxN

stereographic_corr_length(output='No', coeffCinf=array([1]), pc=10, usePI=False, plotOT=False, colorbar=<matplotlib.colors.ListedColormap object>)[source]¶
Parameters

  • output (str) – Destination of the figure file

  • coeffCinf (np.array) – array of coeeficient you want to applied to Cinf (dimention N, means N figure plotted)

  • pc (float) – percentage of highest orientation taken in the statistic (Between 0 and 100)

  • usePI (bool) – compute the autocorrelation radius using the “Porte Integrale” (default False) overwise It compute the intersection between Cinf and Ax
